document_notes.text:
This update for sudo fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-43995: Fixed a potential heap-based buffer over-read when entering a password  of seven characters or fewer and using the crypt() password backend (bsc#1204986).

SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP4

notes.text: Sudo 1.8.0 through 1.9.12, with the crypt() password backend, contains a plugins/sudoers/auth/passwd.c array-out-of-bounds error that can result in a heap-based buffer over-read. This can be triggered by arbitrary local users with access to Sudo by entering a password of seven characters or fewer. The impact could vary depending on the system libraries, compiler, and processor architecture.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
